title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, March 16, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife thanking her for the pictures of the family she sent. He sends messages for all the children, and instructions on how to care for them. He worries about his wife's "delicate" appearance, and complains of his loneliness. He also discusses his pending resignation and news about friends and family.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
